sen.j: 本来は旧暦による月の別名である。
sen.e: Originally the old calendar (the lunar calendar) gave the name to each month.

sen.e: Originally the old calendar (the lunar calendar) gave the name to each month.

sen.j: そのまま新暦に適用すると季節感が合わなくなる。
sen.e: When the solar calendar is used, the meanings of the months don't synchronize with the seasons.

sen.j: 春分の日と秋分の日の日付は、前年2月1日の官報で発表される。

sen.j: （2006年まで）国民の祝日が日曜日の場合、その翌日が休日となる。
sen.e: (Until 2006) If a national holiday falls on a Sunday, the following day becomes a holiday.
(Until 2006) If a national holiday falls on a Sunday, the following day becomes a holiday.
(Until 2006) If a national holiday falls on a Sunday, the following day becomes a holiday.

sen.j: この日を振替休日という。
sen.e: This holiday is called furikae kyujitsu (a substitute holiday)
This holiday is called furikae kyujitsu (a substitute holiday)
This holiday is called furikae kyujitsu (a substitute holiday)

sen.j: （2007年以降）国民の祝日が日曜日である場合に、その直後の「国民の祝日でない日」が休日となる。
sen.e: (Since 2007) If a national holiday falls on a Sunday, the following "non-holiday" becomes a holiday.
(Since 2007) If a national holiday falls on a Sunday, the following "non-holiday" becomes a holiday.
(Since 2007) If a national holiday falls on a Sunday, the following "non-holiday" becomes a holiday.

sen.j: この日を振替休日という。
sen.e: This holiday is called furikae kyujitsu (a substitute holiday)
This holiday is called furikae kyujitsu (a substitute holiday)
This holiday is called furikae kyujitsu (a substitute holiday)

sen.j: たとえば、5月3日（憲法記念日）・5月4日（みどりの日）・5月5日（こどもの日）のうちいずれかが日曜日である場合に、5月6日が休日となる。
sen.e: For example, if May 3, May 4, or May 5 falls a Sunday, May 6 becomes a holiday.
For example, if May 3, May 4, or May 5 falls a Sunday, May 6 becomes a holiday.
For example, if May 3, May 4, or May 5 falls a Sunday, May 6 becomes a holiday.

sen.j: 前日と翌日が国民の祝日で、なおかつその日が日曜日もしくは振替休日でない日は休日となる。
sen.e: If the day between two other national holidays is not a Sunday or a national holiday, that day becomes a holiday.
If the day between two other national holidays is not a Sunday or a national holiday, that day becomes a holiday.
If the day between two other national holidays is not a Sunday or a national holiday, that day becomes a holiday.

sen.j: この日は国民の休日と呼ばれる。
sen.e: This holiday is called kokumin no kyujitsu (holiday for a Nation)
This holiday is called kokumin no kyujitsu (holiday for a Nation)
This holiday is called kokumin no kyujitsu (holiday for a Nation)

sen.j: この規定により休日となることがあるのは5月4日だけだった。
sen.e: According to the above provision, only May 4 could be kokumi no kyujitsu until 2002.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処until 2002 を補いました。
sen.e: According to the above provision, only May 4 could be kokumin no kyujitsu until 2002.
sen.cmt: 国民のスペルミスを修正
sen.e: According to the above provision, only May 4 could be kokumin no kyujitsu until 2002.

sen.j: 2003年の祝日法改正によって敬老の日と秋分の日との間の日数が1日となって休日となる年も出ることになった。
